intro: Scutellaria peregrina, commonly known as the wandering scutellaria, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces blue to violet flowers in whorled clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its root system is fibrous, and it thrives in well-drained soils in sunny to partially shaded environments. Scutellaria peregrina is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions.
